fields.description:
Create a bucket, upload an object and go to object detail page. 404 error is displayed.
See screenshot.

I Could reproduce it on both shared setup #1 and #2
fields.summary: Going to object detail page results in a 404 error on euca

comments.body: [~dkavanagh]: This regression seems to have been introduced in https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/commit/c7f83a509240e1a1ec851e2a78040f7ba961c78e#diff-e208023217ec45da0b8534a7f34c6c92R853 , since removing that line allows the object details page to display.  Do you recall why that line was added to the object details page view?
Yes, this was well described in the linked ticket.

[~alice], this doesn't happen on the console I have installed from nightlies behind and ELB. If I could have the shared-setup-1 private ssh key, I could login and look at the system where the error happens.

After investigating the shared setup, the ufshost setting was the problem.
It was prefixed with "compute." but should not be. After [~ccassler] fixed it, the problem went away. I propose we close "wont' fix"

Assigning to [~kgill], please reassign if needed.  

I still see this error from console installed from packages on a centos box that points directly to IP of the machine hosting UFS of shared setup #2:

snippet from cinsile.ini:

{code}
## EUCA config
ufshost=10.111.1.62
ufsport = 8773
{code}

I also see a 404 when logged in to shared setup #2 via its console https://c-27.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/

{code}
## EUCA config
ufshost = localhost
ufsport = 8773
{code}
[~alice], [~dkavanagh]: I don't see any other way to fix this other than reintroducing the fix in PR 1599 and marking GUI-1993 as a known issue.  Please advise.
[~kgill] GUI-1993 seems to me like the lesser of the two problems
[~alice]: Agreed, I've reopened PR 1599 to fix this
Has anybody looked at why it fails? I'm going to do that before ripping out this other fix.
[~dkavanagh] please feel free to poke around on QA setup #2  https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/QA/QA+Shared+Setups#QASharedSetups-SharedSetup#2(VPC)

I can reproduce this on my laptop using the IP of our team cloud. It relates to a trailing slash in the service path and I'm looking through the change history of buckets.py to see what other change affected this.

I think this diff is the one to look at: https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/commit/b1ca3cba3d6d31f24e1f1e4b8d8714311fdc6a92#diff-c8dbccf4ef1ce28db5c8808ff9d73422

Pretty sure we just need to ensure a trailing slash. I'll work on this later or over the weekend.
I've updated the GUI-2082 branch. Needs more manual testing after CI passes.
